title: A new type of lesson
description:
So far, the flow has been simple: write code, run it, and match the exact output. That works for tiny programs, but it doesn’t scale when we start writing **functions.**
From this point on, you’ll start seeing somthing new:
## Unit Tests:

You write _only the function_ the lesson asks for **(no main())**.
When you click Run, a hidden test harness calls your function with a few sample inputs.
mWhen you click Submit, the harness runs many more tests, including tricky edge cases.
Think of it like shipping your code to real users: Run is your quick local check, Submit is the full test suite.
The function lessons will ramp up in difficulty, but the tests will always tell you _exactly_ how your function is behaving.
